SEARCH

Class managerCmds

java.lang.Object
managerCmds
public class managerCmds extends Object
Class to handle various operations related to managers, such as managing inventory, menu items, and orders.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    managerCmds()
    Constructor to initialize the database connection.

    • updateIngredient

      public boolean updateIngredient(int ingredientID, int currentCount, String newName, float newPPU, int deltaCount, int newMinimum, String logMessage)
      Updates the information of an ingredient in the database.
      Parameters:
      ingredientID - The ID of the ingredient to be updated.
      currentCount - The current count of the ingredient.
      newName - The new name of the ingredient (null or empty to skip).
      newPPU - The new price per unit of the ingredient (0 or negative to skip).
      deltaCount - The change in count of the ingredient.
      newMinimum - The new minimum amount of the ingredient (0 to skip).
      logMessage - The log message associated with the update.
      Returns:
      True if the update was successful, false otherwise.

    • addIngredient

      public boolean addIngredient(int newID, String ingredientName, int count, float PPU, int minamount)
      Adds a new ingredient to the database.
      Parameters:
      newID - The ID of the new ingredient.
      ingredientName - The name of the new ingredient.
      count - The count of the new ingredient.
      PPU - The price per unit of the new ingredient.
      minamount - The minimum amount of the new ingredient.
      Returns:
      True if the addition was successful, false otherwise.

      Parameters:

      ingredientCount - The count of the ingredient to be deleted.
      Returns:
      True if the deletion was successful, false otherwise.

      customerName - The new name of the customer (null or empty to skip).
      basePrice - The new base price of the order (0 or negative to skip).
      employeeID - The ID of the employee associated with the order (0 or negative to skip).
      Returns:
      True if the update was successful, false otherwise.

      Parameters:

      upperBound - The upper bound of the date range (YYYY-MM-DD).
      Returns:
      OrderingTrendReport object containing the ordering trends within the specified date range.
